abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column examines legal battle waged by New York City Police Officer Akema Thompson after she was refused option of taking a makeup exam when date of sergeant's exam fell on her anticipated childbirth due date; Thompson filed pregnancy discrimination charge against city with Equal Employment Opportunity Commission in March 2014; city agreed in July 2015 to a settlement that includes commitment to allow Officer Thompson to take test in January 2016.
lead_paragraph: Officer Akema Thompson was recovering from childbirth on the day of the exam, but officials said her request for a makeup test was “not approvable.” The city settled her discrimination case last month.

headline.main: Pregnant Officer Denied Chance to Take Sergeant’s Exam Fights Back
